intro: Vincetoxicum capense, commonly known as the Cape wine vine, is a climbing plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are follicles containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Vincetoxicum capense is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
